body: Hmm yes that really sounds related to that. To me it sounds like a bug in the module concatenation, especially the algorithm that selects which modules are concatenated. Probably related to the runtime filtering. I have one idea which I can try to figure out how to reproduce it (note to myself: entry A -> c -> d, entry B -> d, c and d force to chunk, c + d concatenated, maybe c -> d conditional).

issue.title: fix incorrect concatenation when module runtime are merged

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

body:
Ok I found something. Looks really like your issue. I'm pretty sure https://github.com/webpack/webpack/pull/11861 fixes your issue, but it would be great if you could test it in your codebase.

```
"webpack": "webpack/webpack#bugfix/11856
```
Yes, just tested and this issue is fixed in the branch.

webpack@5.31.0 still get this problem

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8725110/113966327-7b21e280-9861-11eb-8e64-e316565b33a1.png)

`concatenateModules: false ` can fix it。

@Knagis @sokra  Could you reopen this issue?

issue.title: __webpack_require__(null)

repository.name: webpack.js.org
repository.description: Repository for webpack documentation and more!

issue.body:
webpack@5.31.0 still get this problem

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8725110/113966327-7b21e280-9861-11eb-8e64-e316565b33a1.png)

`concatenateModules: false ` can fix it。

@Knagis @sokra  Could you reopen this issue?

_Originally posted by @YikaJ in https://github.com/webpack/webpack/issues/11856#issuecomment-815426944_

body:
same issue here with `webpack@5.31.2`. We are doing a re-export of modules if that helps.

---

Update: it turns out from https://github.com/webpack/webpack.js.org/issues/4837 the solution is to just remove `new webpack.optimize.ModuleConcatenationPlugin()`, which solved the error for me.

issue.title: Prerender ist not compatible with last webpack (5.38.1) module

repository.name: scrivito_example_app_js
repository.description: Scrivito is a flexible, scalable, and secure web CMS built to orchestrate digital experiences globally across multiple channels, react to market changes quickly and deliver great results cost-efficiently.

issue.body:
Steps:
1. Delete the file `package-lock.json`
2. Run `npm install`
3. Run `SCRIVITO_ORIGIN=http://localhost:8080 npm run prerender`

You will get an error in the buildNode/prerender_content.js 

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined
```
